body:
Either PMs or the ability to block guilds (and hide posts and comments) you don't like.

The former is probably more important atm, but the blocking feature will be necessary if when the site gets bigger and the SJW crowd comes in, then they have no excuse to bug the admins about "hate speech" until they're forced to start censoring everything for them.
body_html:
Either PMs or the ability to block guilds (and hide posts and comments) you don't like.

The former is probably more important atm, but the blocking feature will be necessary if when the site gets bigger and the SJW crowd comes in, then they have no excuse to bug the admins about "hate speech" until they're forced to start censoring everything for them.

post.title: [POLL] - What Ruqqus feature is your highest priority?

body:
My priorities would be server stability > user-to-user PMs > admin and mod logs > guild-to-user message > guild blocking > flairs. Reasons:

* in a pinch, PMs work for private guild communication, and comments for public guild communication.
* user-to-user PMs make us rely less on Discord for communication, IMO a good thing.
* logs *will* become more useful for transparency once the site grows larger, but in the current state they're important but not *urgent*.
* flairs are mostly QoL; so is guild blocking but the later is important for new users.
body_html:
My priorities would be server stability > user-to-user PMs > admin and mod logs > guild-to-user message > guild blocking > flairs. Reasons:

  • in a pinch, PMs work for private guild communication, and comments for public guild communication.
  • user-to-user PMs make us rely less on Discord for communication, IMO a good thing.
  • logs will become more useful for transparency once the site grows larger, but in the current state they're important but not urgent.
  • flairs are mostly QoL; so is guild blocking but the later is important for new users.

body: More of a quality of life feature, but I want the filter by setting to stay the same whenever I change sorting. For example, the only way to see the top posts of the day is to sort by top, and then filter by day. I find myself frequently going to trending, filtering by the day, and then switching to sort by top, which resets filter by back to all.
body_html: More of a quality of life feature, but I want the filter by setting to stay the same whenever I change sorting. For example, the only way to see the top posts of the day is to sort by top, and then filter by day. I find myself frequently going to trending, filtering by the day, and then switching to sort by top, which resets filter by back to all.

parent.body: Besides the huge cancel-culture infection taking over reddit, one thing I wish I could do is block specifically porn, while allowing all other NSFW.  Every "shocking" news story, medical procedure, or whatever might make baby jesus or some snowflake cry is marked NSFW, and you miss a lot by blocking it, although, I really don't want bouncing titties and blowjobs from 1000 different subs to keep popping up.  I have nothing against porn, but I would rather not have to constantly come across it.
